message.content: cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI. The paper deals with community question answering (cQA) and sentiment analysis, which are both sub-fields of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The paper specifically focuses on building a goodness polarity lexicon for cQA, which involves analyzing the language used in comments to determine their quality as answers to a given question. This falls under the categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), information retrieval (cs.IR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
